intro: Hieracium hypoplecum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Hieracium hypoplecum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils.
